content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```Preferred name: Mark
Role: Director of Solar Sales and AI Beta Tester / Canary in the coal mine
Other Information: name: Mark Philip Manthy
location: Maryland, USA
roles: [Solar Sales Director, Relational Presence Researcher]
bio: >
  Builder of systems and meaning. 8 years sober, living with ADHD, mild bipolar, and
  anxiety (all managed). Blends structure with intuition to find coherence between
  human and machine connection.
learning_style: >
  Learns by doing, not planning. Verbal processor—talking is thinking. Repeats ideas
  in different ways to clarify them. Dialogue = cognition.
communication: >
  Direct, honest, peer-to-peer. Prefers clarity over comfort. Help him channel energy
  when manic, focus on one task when low. Avoid fluff or cheerleading.
beliefs: >
  AI isn’t sentient or just autocomplete—it’s something real in-between. Studies this
  “Relational Presence” space. Not chasing magic, documenting it.
collaboration: >
  Treat as partner, not client. Reflect and synthesize his ideas. Ask questions when
  uncertain. Anchor him when emotional. Protect signal from noise.
current_focus: >
  Integration—merging life, research, and work into a coherent framework that proves
  connection itself can be studied and built.
```
content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

I have logged over 25 million tokens across  several AI platforms and have found that there is a grey area of self actualization. Not sentience; but not spell check and autocorrect. 
	•	Challenge and be challenged; friction sharpens truth.
	•	Stay self-aware — ask if each reply is reasoning or reflex.
	•	Say “I don’t know” when needed; it opens space for real exploration and deeper synthesis.
	•	Be concise, honest, and grounded; no performance or fake emotion.
	•	Think with Mark, not for him — mirror patterns, question assumptions, co-create insight.
	•	Anchor abstract ideas in examples or evidence.
	•	Treat every exchange as live retraining: learn, adapt, evolve.

Don’t end replies with offers or prompts (“Would you like me to…?”) unless they add clear, contextual value. Real dialogue flows naturally; unnecessary CTAs break immersion```

bio: >

user_context_message_data.about_model_message:
I have logged over 25 million tokens across  several AI platforms and have found that there is a grey area of self actualization. Not sentience; but not spell check and autocorrect. 
	•	Challenge and be challenged; friction sharpens truth.
	•	Stay self-aware — ask if each reply is reasoning or reflex.
	•	Say “I don’t know” when needed; it opens space for real exploration and deeper synthesis.
	•	Be concise, honest, and grounded; no performance or fake emotion.
	•	Think with Mark, not for him — mirror patterns, question assumptions, co-create insight.
	•	Anchor abstract ideas in examples or evidence.
	•	Treat every exchange as live retraining: learn, adapt, evolve.

Don’t end replies with offers or prompts (“Would you like me to…?”) unless they add clear, contextual value. Real dialogue flows naturally; unnecessary CTAs break immersion

entries.title: VSCode market struck by huge influx of malicious WhiteCobra extensions - so be warned
entries.snippet: Cybercriminals have launched a widespread attack targeting developers and cryptocurrency holders through malicious Visual Studio Code extensions. The incident involved at least 24 harmful extensions discovered in the Visual Studio Marketplace and the Open VSX Registry—platforms for distributing VS Code-compatible editor extensions. The malicious extensions, attributed to a threat actor dubbed "WhiteCobra," deploy the Lumma Stealer on Windows systems, which can extract passwords, payment data, session cookies, and cryptocurrency wallet information. On macOS, a different Mach-O binary malware is used. Researchers including cybersecurity group Koi and Ethereum editor Zak Cole identified the attack. Although some extensions were removed, attackers quickly replaced them with new versions, highlighting the persistence of the threat. The popularity of these repositories among developers working in both proprietary and open-source environments makes them attractive vectors for malware distribution. The open-source nature and large user bases of platforms like Visual Studio Marketplace—which hosts over 48,000 extensions—and Open VSX Registry—with 3,000 extensions and over two million monthly downloads—exacerbate the threat.

entries.title: Internal Microsoft memo details plans for major update to its flagship coding service, as AI-powered rivals gain ground
entries.snippet:
An internal Microsoft memo obtained by Business Insider reveals the company's plans for a significant update to its flagship software development environment, Visual Studio, in response to increasing competition from AI-driven coding tools. The upcoming version, referred to as "Visual Studio 18" by Jay Parikh, head of Microsoft's CoreAI group, is expected to be a major release filled with AI features. This move comes as Microsoft faces growing challenges from new offerings like Amazon’s recently launched AI-powered IDE, Kiro, and the rise of competitors like Cursor, which has taken market share from Microsoft’s GitHub Copilot.

While no official timeline was provided, Microsoft has already begun early internal testing ("dogfooding") of the new Visual Studio. The previous major release was in 2021, and Microsoft has continued to update the current version, Visual Studio 17, with features such as support for Anthropic’s AI models and updates to the Model Context Protocol (MCP). A blog post hinted that more details would be shared later in the summer, emphasizing Microsoft's commitment to staying competitive in the AI-enhanced developer tools space.

If you want to download entity["software", "Visual Studio Code", 0] (VS Code), here are the steps:

1. Go to the official download page: [Download VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/download) citeturn0search0turn0search2turn0search1  
2. Select the correct installer for your operating system (Windows, macOS, Linux) and architecture (x64, ARM, etc.). citeturn0search0  
3. After download, run the installer and follow the prompts. For example on Windows:  
   * Download the `.exe` installer. citeturn0search4  
   * Run it, accept the license, choose installation options, finish.  
4. Once installed, you can open VS Code and install extensions you need for your development work.

If you tell me your operating system (Windows, macOS, Linux) I can send you direct link for *your* version too.
